name: ls
description: List directory contents with detailed information, including hidden files and human-readable sizes. Essential for navigating and inspecting file systems.

variations.description: List all files in long format with human-readable sizes.
Long listing format (permissions, owner, size, date).
Long listing, reverse time order (show newest last).

name: grep
description: Search for patterns in files recursively. Supports regular expressions.

variations.description: Search recursively for a pattern starting at a given path.
Show 5 lines of context AFTER the matching line.
Show only filenames of matching files.
Count occurrences of the pattern in the file.
Invert match (show lines NOT containing the pattern).

name: find
description: Search for files and directories in a directory hierarchy.

variations.description: Find files by name within a path.
Find files modified more than 7 days ago.
Find and delete files matching the pattern.
Display all processes running on the system (BSD syntax).
Display all processes running on the system (Standard syntax).
Find a specific process and exclude the grep command itself.
Display processes for a specific user.

name: top
description: Display and update sorted information about running processes.

variations.description: Show processes for a specific user.
Run in batch mode (useful for logging output to a file).

name: htop
description: Interactive process viewer and system monitor. More user-friendly than top.

variations.description: View processes for a specific user.

name: netstat
description: Display network connections, routing tables, and statistics (Legacy).

variations.description: Show listening TCP/UDP ports with PID/program name.
Show all connections and listening ports (numerical addresses).

name: ss
description: Socket statistics utility - modern replacement for netstat.

variations.description: Show listening TCP/UDP sockets with PID/program name.
Capture traffic on interface eth0, port 80 (numerical output).
Capture all traffic and save to a file.
Capture traffic to/from a specific host and port.
Read from a saved pcap file.
Print each packet (minus its link level header) in ASCII.

name: iptables
description: Display firewall rules with verbose output.

variations.description: List all rules in all tables, numerical output, verbose.
Flush (delete) all rules in the current table (DANGEROUS).
List rules in the NAT table.
Block traffic from a specific IP.
Owner rwx, Group r-x, Others r-x.
Add execute permission to all users.
Recursively set permissions to rw- r-- r--.
Set permissions explicitly using symbolic mode.
Copy permissions from file1 to file2.
Change both the owner and the group.
Recursively change owner and group for a directory.
Change only the group of the file.
Copy ownership from file1 to file2.

name: df
description: Display disk space usage in human-readable format.

variations.description: Check disk space for a specific mount point.
Display a grand total of disk usage.

name: du
description: Display disk usage of files and directories.

variations.description: Show disk usage for all files, not just directories.
Show usage for current level and direct subdirectories.
Calculate and display the grand total size.
Show usage excluding specific file patterns.
Create a gzipped archive (c) with filename (f).
List the contents of an archive file.
Append a file to an existing uncompressed archive.

name: systemctl
description: Control and query systemd system and service manager.

variations.description: Check the status of a service.
Enable a service to start on boot.
Disable a service from starting on boot.

name: journalctl
description: Query and display systemd journal logs.

variations.description: View logs for a service and follow (f) in real-time.
View all log entries with details and explanatory text.
View logs since the beginning of today.
Show how much disk space the journal is using.
Delete journal logs older than 2 days.

name: tail
description: Display and follow the end of a file in real-time.

variations.description: Follow the file (f) as it grows.
Follow file until the specified process ID dies.

name: less
description: View file contents with scrolling and search capabilities.

variations.description: View file and automatically scroll/follow to the end.
Open file for standard viewing and scrolling.
View file with long lines chopped (no wrap).

name: sed
description: Stream editor for filtering and transforming text.

variations.description: Add a prefix to the beginning of every line.
Add a suffix to the end of every line.

name: awk
description: Pattern scanning and text processing language.

variations.description: Print the first column ($1) of each line.
Use colon (:) as the field separator (F) and print first field.
Sum the values in the first column.

name: curl
description: Transfer data from or to a server.

variations.description: Download a file and save it with the specified name.
Send a POST request with data.
Send a request with Basic Authentication.
Download and save with a specific filename.

name: ssh
description: Secure shell - connect to remote servers securely.

variations.description: Connect using a specified identity file (i).

name: scp
description: Securely copy files between hosts over SSH.

variations.description: Copy local file to remote host.
Copy remote file to local directory.
Copy using a specific identity file.

name: rsync
description: Sync files and directories efficiently between locations.

variations.description: Archive mode (a), verbose (v), compressed (z) remote sync.
Sync directories, deleting files in destination not found in source.
Sync using a custom SSH port.
List all containers, including stopped ones.
List containers with a custom format.

name: docker logs
description: Display and follow logs from a Docker container.

variations.description: Display and follow (f) logs in real-time.
Display the last 50 lines of logs.
Show extra details provided to logs.
List all pods in the current namespace.
List pods with more details (IP, Node).
List pods in a specific namespace.

name: kubectl logs
description: Display and follow logs from a Kubernetes pod.

variations.description: Print the logs for a container in a pod.
Print the logs for the previous instance of the container.
Print the logs for a specific container in a pod.

name: free
description: Display memory usage in human-readable format.

variations.description: Display memory usage in human-readable (h) format.
Display a line showing the column totals.
Show detailed low and high memory statistics.
Display a single report since boot.
Display a table of various counters and event totals.
Display the number of forks since boot.
Display statistics in kilobytes per second.
Display statistics in megabytes per second.
Display statistics for block devices and all their partitions.
List processes using a specific port (80).
List processes that have a specific file open.
List files opened by a specific user.
List files opened by a specific command.
Recursively list open files in a directory.
Scan (z) ports 1-1000 on a host (verbose v).
Check if a TCP port (80) is open.
Listen (l) on a port (8080) for incoming connections.
Connect with a timeout of 3 seconds.
Keep listening after the current connection is closed.

name: ping
description: Send ICMP echo requests to test network connectivity.

variations.description: Send continuous pings until manually stopped.
Ping with an interval of 0.5 seconds.

name: traceroute
description: Trace the network path packets take to reach a destination.

variations.description: Do not resolve IP addresses to hostnames (faster).

name: nmap
description: Network mapper - scan ports and detect service versions.

variations.description: Scan all ports (p-) and probe to determine service versions (sV).
Default scan of the top 1000 ports.
Ping scan (sn) to list hosts that are up on a subnet.
Enable OS detection, version detection, script scanning, and traceroute.
Fast mode - Scan fewer ports than the default scan.

name: crontab
description: Edit cron jobs for scheduled task automation.

variations.description: Edit the current user's crontab file.
Schedule a command to run in one hour.
Cat the contents of a specific job.
Schedule a command to run at a specific time.

name: kill
description: Force kill a process by PID.

variations.description: Send SIGHUP (often used to reload configuration).
Kill processes matching the full command line (f).
Kill all processes owned by a specific user.
Kill the oldest process matching the name.
Kill the newest process matching the name.

name: nohup
description: Run command immune to hangups, in the background.

variations.description: Run command in background, ignoring hangups.
Run in background and discard all output.
Run in background and save output to a file.
Create a new session with a name (S).
Detach a running session and reattach to it.
Create a new session with a name (s).
Mount the device to the mount point.
Remount the root filesystem as read-write.
Unmount the device at the mount point.
Lazy unmount (detach now, clean up later).

name: fdisk
description: List all disk partitions with detailed information.

variations.description: List the partition tables for all devices.
Enter the interactive utility for device sda (DANGEROUS).
Display the size of the partition.
List the partition table for a specific device.

name: dmesg
description: Display the kernel ring buffer messages.

variations.description: Search for error messages in the kernel log.
Clear the ring buffer after printing.

name: uptime
description: Show how long the system has been running, and load averages.

variations.description: Display the time the system has been up since.

name: who
description: Display who is logged in to the system.

variations.description: Display the time of the last system boot.
Display only the count of logged in users.

name: w
description: Show who is logged in and what they are doing.

variations.description: Show information for a specific user.

name: mysql
description: Connect to a MySQL server and run administrative commands.

variations.description: Connect as root user, prompting for password.

name: SHOW PROCESSLIST
description: Display currently executing database connections and queries.

variations.description: Show the first 100 characters of each query.
Show the full text of all currently running queries.

name: nproc
description: Print the number of processing units available.

variations.description: Print the number of processing units available to the current process.
Print the number of installed processors.
Exclude 1 processing unit from the count.

name: ncdu
description: NCurses Disk Usage: An interactive disk usage analyzer that provides a fast, graphical way to see where disk space is being used.

variations.description: Scans the current directory or the specified directory and displays an interactive, navigable list of files and subdirectories sorted by size.
Scans the root directory (/) but **skips directories on different filesystems** (e.g., skips network mounts or /proc). This is recommended for full system scans.
Runs in **read-only mode** (`-r`), preventing accidental file deletions (`d` key) while analyzing disk usage in the `/home` directory.
Export the scan results to a file.
Import scan results from a file.

name: sudo
description: Execute a command as another user, typically the superuser.

variations.description: Run command as a specific user.
Run a shell as the target user.
Kill the timestamp (force password prompt next time).
List allowed commands for the current user.

name: useradd
description: Create a new user or update default new user information.

variations.description: Create a new user with default settings.
Create user with home directory (-m) and specific shell (-s).
Create user and add to a secondary group.
Create user with an expiry date.
Create user with a specific UID.
Delete a user's password (make account passwordless).
Expire a password, forcing change on next login.
Kill all processes with the given name.
Kill all processes owned by a specific user.

name: ip
description: Show / manipulate routing, network devices, interfaces and tunnels.

variations.description: Show IP addresses assigned to all interfaces.

name: crontab
description: Maintain crontab files for individual users.

name: iw

Create a listening socket and print incoming data to stdout.

name: history

name: cat

name: shutdown
description: Halt, power-off or reboot the machine.

name: mysql select
examples: SELECT id, name FROM users WHERE id = 1;
SELECT * FROM users ORDER BY created_at DESC LIMIT 10;

variations.description: Select all columns from a table.

variations.description: Select specific columns with a condition.
